files.patch:
@@ -1450,1 +1450,1 @@
-In order to backout a change, the `hg backout` command is recommended, which essentially applies the anti-delta of the change. Make sure you perform the backout in the most upstream repostiory the change has escaped to.
+In order to backout a change, the `hg backout` command is recommended, which essentially applies the anti-delta of the change. Make sure you perform the backout in the most upstream repository the change has escaped to.
@@ -1492,1 +1492,1 @@
-There can be cases where it is motivated to create a backport issue before the fix is done. In these cases set the fix version of the backport to `N-pool`, where `N` is the release train the backport is targeting. E.g. `17-pool`
+There can be cases where it is motivated to create a backport issue before the fix is done. In these cases set the fix version of the backport to `N-pool`, where `N` is the release train the backport is targeting. E.g. `17-pool`. Please note that even if a backport issue is created ahead of time, all work done in JBS is stil done in the main issue.
